Police have launched a manhunt for an attempted murderer after a woman was attacked while taking her springer spaniel for an early morning walk on a quiet country path.

The victim, who is in her 50s,... [1629 symbols]
articles.summary: Police in Suffolk have launched a manhunt for an attempted murderer after a woman was attacked while out walking her dog on a country path. The victim, who is in her 50s, was found unconscious and with severe injuries on an isolated path by members of the public. She was taken to Addenbrookes hospital where she remains in a critical condition. The incident is being treated as an attempted murder and a police cordon remains at the scene at Rectory Lane, in Brantham, Suffolk. The woman's dog, a Springer Spaniel, was with her at the time of the attack and is safe and well. Suffolk Constabulary is asking for witnesses to report suspicious activity in the area.

articles.summary: A woman was fatally shot in the San Antonio district of East Oakland, California, early Thursday morning. The victim was identified as a woman in her 20s and was found by police officers in the 2000 block of International Boulevard. Despite attempts to save her life, she was pronounced dead at the scene. This is the 52nd homicide investigated by Oakland police this year and the first since July 13. Police and Crime Stoppers of Oakland are offering up to $10,000 in reward money for information leading to the arrest of the killer.

articles.summary: Charges against Malinda Hoagland's father and his girlfriend, Cindy Warren, have been upgraded to first-degree murder and conspiracy in the starvation and torture death of 12-year-old Malinda Haggland. The child was found dead in May at 50 pounds and with bruises and deformities to her arms and legs. The new charges also include second and third-degree murders. Malinda was removed from the Coatesville Area School District in January and placed in a cyber school. Police allege that Malinda, who weighed 50 pounds, was starved for months and forced to perform strenuous exercises while chained to furniture, which were allegedly undetected. Prosecutors are set to hold a news conference at a 1 p.m. news conference discussing the new charges.

articles.summary: New Eagles running back Saquon Barkley has expressed dissatisfaction with HBO's "Hard Knocks" for recording of his phone call to say goodbye to the New York Giants during free agency. Barkley had no idea his conversation with Giants management was recorded and aired on the documentary television series. He insists he was portrayed fairly, despite the recorded call being offside. Barkley signed a three-year deal with the Eagles for $26 million guaranteed and $37.75 million overall, making him the highest-paid running back in franchise history. The show's coverage of Barkley's departure was part of a series detailing his departure from the Giants after six seasons. Since 2001, the show has been a staple of the NFL fans' view of the show, focusing on specific teams during summer training camps and the regular season.

articles.summary: The Pennsylvania Turnpike is moving away from toll booths and introducing "open road tolling" on the eastern and northeastern portions of the turnpike. The cashless, free-flowing mode of collecting tolls eliminates the need for separate toll lanes and booths. Tolls will still be collected, sent to you in mail or deducted from your EZ Pass account. The move to open road tollings will take effect on Jan. 5, 2025 on all parts of the Turnpix east of Reading and on the Northeast Extension. Toll booths for the remainder of the PA Turnpikes, from Reading and westward, will be eliminated in 2027.

articles.summary: Michael Lopez, the suspect in the killing of Melvindale police officer Mohamed Said, has been formally charged with 12 counts including murdering a peace officer. Lopez was previously released from prison last month after serving about 12 years in relation to a carjacking incident in which he admitted stealing a 1997 Dodge Dakota from a man in Detroit. He was charged with five crimes, including taking the officer’s gun, fleeing a police officer, and assault with intent to rob, but these charges were dropped after he pleaded guilty to carjacker and a count of assaulting, resisting and obstructing causing injury of a cop. Lopez is charged as a habitual offender and could face up to life in prison.

He was previously accused of taking his gun after a carjacking in Detroit more than a decade ago. Lopez was released from prison last month after serving about 12 years in that incident. In the 2011 carjacker case, a Detroit Police officer was treated at a hospital and had to have a cast put on his right hand after Lopez admitted to the incident. Lopez admitted stealing a 1997 Dodge Dakota from a man in Detroit and later assaulting the truck owner, permanently injuring the victim's eye. He served 18 years in prison for the two felonies, 18 years shy of the maximum 30-year sentence.

articles.summary: The sole survivor of the Nepal plane crash that left 18 dead, Captain Manish Ratna Shakya, survived after his cockpit broke off from the aircraft on impact. He was pulled from the cockpit five minutes after the plane went down near Kathmandu airport. The Saurya Airlines plane crashed shortly after takeoff when it turned right and collided with a storage container. The collision tore the cockpit off and sent the rest of the aircraft careening into a valley where it was torn to pieces. Shakya survived the crash but was rescued within five minutes of the crash and rushed to hospital with injuries including broken bones in his back and head and facial injuries. The plane's co-pilot, Sasant Katuwal, had only been flying for three years. An initial assessment suggests that the plane took a wrong turn due to the wrong turn.

articles.summary: The murder trial of Ashley Benefield, a Florida ballerina, has begun with explosive opening statements in which she admitted to fatally shooting her husband, Douglas "Doug" Benefield. The case, known as the "Black Swan Murder Trial," is being referred to as the case being dubbed "the Black Swan Murder" by prosecutors. Prosecutors claim that Ashley wanted to get her husband out of her and her daughter's lives and would "stop at nothing" to achieve this goal. The defense claims that Doug Benefield was abusive and intimidating and had previously thrown a loaded gun at Ashley and punched their dog in the face so hard that he knocked the dog unconscious. The state argues that Ashley Benefedged was not injured and that she was armed with a gun she had previously bought while her husband was unarmed.

articles.summary: Joanne Sharkey, a 55-year-old Liverpool woman, has denied the murder of a baby who was discovered in woodland 26 years ago. Sharkey is accused of murdering her infant child, later named Callum, and attempting to conceal the birth of another child. The charges were brought at Liverpool Crown Court and entered not guilty pleas to both counts. The trial is set for January 14. The infant Callum was named after the Callands district of Warrington, where he was found dead. His funeral service was attended by local people and he was buried in Warrington Cemetery a few months later.

articles.summary: A father and son, Martin and Shaun Breeze, have been found guilty of murdering Brian Darby, 60, in a hit-and-run revenge attack in Ingleby Barwick. Darby was killed and three others were injured when Martin Breeze hit them with his van. Shaun was found guilty also of manslaughter and three counts of causing grievous bodily harm with intent. Both men will be sentenced on 2 August. The verdict was reached after four hours of deliberation and jurors found their guilty verdicts following a two-week trial. Both father and sons were also found guilty in relation to their false report of the van being stolen.

articles.summary: Robert Buntyn, a 24-year-old motorist from Texas, was killed in 2021 after hitting a semi truck stopped on an interstate. A Dallas County jury awarded his family $3.6 million in June, largely due to the negligence of a North Texas trucking company and a truck driver. The lawsuit alleges that the truck stopped due to a mechanical issue and the driver did not deploy flares or triangles to warn oncoming drivers. Despite the trial and jury verdict, a final judgment has not yet been entered. A final hearing is scheduled for August 16. The wrongful death lawsuit was first filed in December 2021 by the family and asked for damages no less than $1 million.

articles.summary: Israel has warned that Iranian terrorists are planning an attack on Israelis at the 2024 Paris Olympics. Israeli Foreign Minister Israel Katz has informed his French counterpart, Stéphane Séjourné, of an alleged Iranian-backed plot to attack the Israeli delegation of athletes. Despite acknowledging the "unprecedented security measures" in place by French security forces to protect Israelis attending the games, Katz also noted that French authorities have rejected calls from the Left to ban all Israeli participants from the Olympics. There are currently 88 Israeli athletes at the games and they have been given unprecedented protection from both French and Israeli security services. However, there is no evidence linking the alleged attack to the Paris Olympics yet.

The final day of Florida's lobster mini-season ends at 11:59 p., and small boats should be advised to avoid rough waters over the Atlantic and Keys. This weekend will be marked by scattered showers and storms, with temperatures expected to reach the low 90s and potentially feel like triple digits.

Her partner, Shaine March, was arrested and charged with her murder the following day. March appeared at the Old Bailey by video link from Belmarsh prison and was remanded into custody. A plea hearing was set for October 23, with a provisional trial from May 6 next year scheduled for up to three weeks at the Bailey. Odyseos’s sister, Jasmine Yates, described her as a “happy and bubbly person” who had recently discovered she was expecting a third child.

Witnesses initially identified Moore as the suspect following a verbal argument at the bowling alley. Moore is currently being held in the North Central Regional Jail on $100,000 bond.

articles.title: Getting kids up close with nature is the goal of this environmental center in southeastern Massachusetts

articles.content:
Getting kids up close with nature is the goal of the Lloyd Center in Massachusetts

Getting kids up close with nature is the goal of the Lloyd Center in Massachusetts

Getting kids up close with natur... [2526 symbols]
articles.summary: The Lloyd Center for the Environment in Dartmouth, Massachusetts has been teaching children about nature for over 40 years and aims to instill a respect and affection for nature for children. The center, which includes five miles of hiking trails and a canoe trip, hosts students from both southeastern Massachusetts and Rhode Island for a coastal field study that includes four unique stations about the environment. Up to 15,000 students visit the center each year. Executive director Rachel Stronach also plans to open a new welcome center later this summer that will meet strict environmental building standards and generate more energy than it uses. The Lloyd Center's mission is to have a positive impact on the students who visit and educate them about coastal and watershed issues.

articles.summary: Keanu Dude, a member of the San Carlos Apache Tribe, has been arrested on a charge of arson in connection with a wildfire that destroyed 21 homes and left dozens unsheltered. The wildfire, which began on July 10 as a small brush fire, torched 2,000 acres of Native American reservation land, destroyed homes, and led to evacuations. The incident was one of the latest in the West that police have tied to a suspect. It remains unclear how the fire was started. In California, authorities are searching for suspects who allegedly sparked a major wildfire with illegal fireworks. The Hawarden Fire, which was ignited on Sunday, has caused over 1,500 residents to leave their homes and damaged several others, with damage estimated at $11 million.

articles.content: Arizona police arrested a man on a charge of arson in connection with a wildfire that torched 2,000 acres of Native American reservation land, destroying homes, triggering evacuations and leaving doze... [3772 symbols]

keywords.name: San Carlos Apache Tribe Chairman Terry Rambler

entities.data: the San Carlos Apache Police Department

articles.summary: Keanu Dude, a member of the San Carlos Apache Tribe, has been arrested on a charge of arson in connection with a wildfire that destroyed 21 homes and left dozens unsheltered. The wildfire, which began on July 10 as a small brush fire, torched 2,000 acres of Native American reservation land, destroyed homes, and led to evacuations. Dude was arrested for his alleged role in starting the fire. The fire was contained more than a week after it broke out, and damage surveys found that it destroyed 21 houses, forced over 400 members of the Tribe to evacuate the area. In California, authorities are searching for suspects who allegedly sparked a major wildfire with illegal fireworks. The Hawarden Fire has caused over 1,500 residents to leave their homes and damaged several others, with damage estimated at $11 million.

entities.data: The Oregon Department of Fish and Wildlife

articles.summary: Two twin black bear cubs, a brother and sister, have been adopted by Sedgwick County Zoo in Kansas after their mother was shot dead by a hunter. The Oregon Department of Fish and Wildlife (ODFW) rescued the bears from Oregon and contacted the Sedgick County Zoo, which was already on a waiting list to receive black bears in need of a new home. The cubs will be eligible for public viewing in the exhibit as soon as Monday. The zoo's previous resident, Mitch, had passed away in December. To ensure their well-being during transport from Oregon to Wichita, the Sheriff's Office in Oregon provided assistance to the zoo, which had acquired a new plane last year.

articles.title: Man Who Stabbed Salman Rushdie Was Trying to Carry Out Fatwa, Prosecutor Says
articles.description: Prosecutors announced new terrorism charges against the man who stabbed author Salman Rushdie.
articles.content: (BUFFALO, N.Y.) — A man who severely injured author Salman Rushdie in a frenzied knife attack in western New York was motivated by a Hezbollah leader's endorsement of a fatwa calling for Rushdie's dea... [4413 symbols]
articles.summary: Hadi Matar, a U.S. citizen from New Jersey, was charged with terrorism in relation to the stabbing death of Salman Rushdie in 2022, according to prosecutors. The three-count indictment alleges that Matar was motivated by Hezbollah leader's endorsement of a fatwa calling for Rushdie's death. Matar is accused of attempting to carry out the fatwa, which was first issued in 1989 and endorsed by the group's secretary-general, Hassan Nasrallah. The prosecutor stated that he believed the call was backed by Hezbollah and endorsed in a 2006 speech by the leader. Both state and federal charges will proceed to trial separately.

articles.summary: Former Spandau Ballet lead singer and West End stage star Ross Davidson has been convicted of a series of sex offences against three women. He was convicted of one charge of rape and two of sexual assault, and was also found guilty of voyeurism against a fourth woman. The 36-year-old was remanded in custody ahead of sentencing next month. The court heard that Davidson, who used the stage name Wild, revelled in his role as a sex symbol and expected sex on demand, but hid a'sinister side' that included role-playing rape and secretly filming assaults. He confessed to a fetish to wanting sex with a woman while she was asleep and filmed himself groping her breasts.

articles.summary: Cleveland man, Gerrod White, is facing charges of aggravated vehicular homicide and assault for allegedly speeding through a red light and causing a fatal car crash on Cleveland's East Side. The crash, which killed a passenger, Lakeitha Simmons, caused Simmons to die and the driver of the SUV was seriously injured. White was driving eastbound on St. Clair Avenue above the 35 mph and ran the red light, according to police. The Ford Fusion collided with a Ford Explorer, causing it to roll over and throw the driver from the vehicle. White allegedly told responding police officers he was in the passenger seat during the accident and didn't know who was driving. His arraignment is set for Saturday.

The defense ministry's ... [2791 symbols]
articles.summary: A 10-year-old boy has died in a drone attack targeting soldiers in Colombia, marking the first death of its kind in the country that has struggled to control guerrilla violence. The defense ministry's press office attributed the attack to a group of dissident guerrillas who broke away from the FARC when it signed a peace deal with the government. The grenade fell on a soccer field in El Plateado, a stronghold of the Central General Staff (EMC) rebel group. The explosion left six wounded. The country's army commander, General Federico Mejia, condemned the "cowardly terrorist attack". The army has deployed over 800 soldiers in the Cauca department to capture and neutralize the rebel leaders.

In the dock at Belfast Magistrates Court were Jade Mary Anna Harrison, ... [902 symbols]
articles.summary: A man and woman have been charged with murdering 34-year-old Kevin Davidson, whose body was found on 20 July in Belfast. The accused women, Jade Mary Anna Harrison and Colam Barry McClenaghan, were in court at Belfast Magistrates Court. Davidson had not been seen since 8 July and his mother reported him missing, which was unusual and worrying. The court heard that Davidson had died by strangulation. Both the accused have been remanded in custody and will appear on bail on 22 August.

articles.summary: Kathryn Calmus Frankel, a 41-year-old woman from Newtown Square, has been charged with arson, risking catastrophe, reckless burning, and criminal mischief, all felony crimes. She was also charged with dangerous burning, a summary crime. The charges were brought after a police K9 trained on accelerants detected an odor of ignitable material on Frankel's clothes. This is the second time a fire broke out at the property while Frankel was the only person present. No first responders were injured in the fire. The cause of the fire is currently being investigated by the Bureau of Alcohol, Tobacco, Firearms and Explosives, Chester County Fire Marshal’s Office, and Easttown Township Police Department.

articles.summary: Bio Recovery Group LLC, the largest family-owned and operated crime scene cleanup company in the US. The company has announced the appointment of ChatGPT, an advanced artificial intelligence developed by OpenAI, as its new Chief Operating Officer (COO. ChatGpt, formerly of OpenAI), brings extensive experience in operational excellence and innovative solutions to Bio Recovery. The new COO will focus on expanding Bio Recovery's reach and improving service delivery nationwide. This appointment marks a significant step forward in leveraging cutting-edge technology to enhance operational efficiency. The AI's ability to process vast amounts of data and generate actionable insights will be instrumental in driving the company's mission to provide thorough, safe, and compassionate services in biohazard cleanup, death cleanup, and crime scene cleaning.

articles.summary: Two 18-year-olds living in the Gironde region of France have been arrested on charges of preparing terrorist attacks ahead of the 2024 Paris Summer Olympics. The investigations relate to one or more possible violent actions that these young people may have planned, according to France's National Terrorism Prosecution Office. One man was arrested in Gironde, southwest France, while the other was arrested Thursday while traveling. French authorities have been on high alert during the final weeks of preparation for the games. A Russian man was recently arrested for allegedly planning events likely to destabilize the Olympic Games.

A forensic search through his phone also revealed a private photo vault app hiding at least 14 pictures of him sexually abusing the girl. Elwing now faces up to 25 charges related to child pornography, including two capital felony raps for sexual battery of a minor. He is currently being held without bond at Manatee County Jail in Palmetto. If convicted, he could face a minimum sentence of life without parole.

articles.summary: Controversial social media personality Andrew Tate's defamation lawsuit against Florida woman, who accused him of imprisoning her in Romania, can proceed. However, a judge threw out Tate's allegations against her parents and some allegations against the woman. The judge also allowed the lawsuit to pursue allegations that the woman enlisted another woman in a plot to extort money from them. The British-American brothers claim the woman falsely accused them of human trafficking and rape, costing them freedom and millions of dollars in income from their social media, podcasting and business ventures. Romanian officials indicted the Tates last year, alleging they forced seven victims into pornography and physically assaulted them. No trial date has been set and it could take years before one occurs.

articles.summary: Gab founder Andrew Torba announced that Thomas Matthew Crooks, the suspected shooter of President Joe Biden, may have had an account on the social media platform. The account was last active on the site in 2021 and did not use direct messages. However, Torba stated that while the majority of posts were in support of President Biden, they were critical of his policies, including those of the COVID lockdowns, border policies and executive orders. The disclosure of these posts could lead to significant political backlash and personal and business risks. articles.summary: The National-Socialism / White Power (NS/WP) has claimed responsibility for the murder of Irina Farion, a former Ukrainian ultranationalist lawmaker known for her hardline Russophobic stance. Farion was shot dead in the western city of Lviv last week. The group released a video on its private Telegram channel purporting to show the attack, with a message promising to retaliate against other "enemies of Ukrainians". The alleged killer claimed that he murdered Farion due to her outspoken stance on language. An 18-year-old suspect has been arrested in Ukraine following a difficult operation. In spring 2022, Russia's Investigative Committee arrested six NS/WP members for plotting to assassinate prominent journalist Vladimir Solovyov.

Relatives found Campos dead on July 15 in Loganville, Georgia, a city about 35 miles east of Atlanta. Monroy is from Snellville and originally arrested on a charge of making false statements to police on July 17, two days after Campos' body was found. An arrest warrant revealed that Campos was lured into woods by her home and died from asphyxiation.

Goldinger issued a statement disputing testimony from State Police Col. Christopher Paris that two Butler County law enforcement officers left a strategically important post shortly before the attempt. Paris had claimed that the officers were unable to locate Thomas Matthew Crooks, who opened fire from a nearby building rooftop and fatally shot three spectators before being shot by a Secret Service agent at the scene. Both Goldinger and Paris deny these claims. In another development, one of the two spectators who survived the shooting has been discharged from the hospital.

articles.summary: A 10-year-old boy has been killed in Colombia's first drone attack, becoming the first person to die in such an attack in the country. The attack occurred in the town of El Plateado and left 12 others injured. The country's defence ministry said the attack was targeting soldiers and blamed the Carlos Patiño Front, a group of dissident guerrillas who broke away from the Revolutionary Armed Forces of Colombia (Farc) when the Farc signed a peace deal with the Colombian government in 2016. The leader of the group, Kevin Arcos, denied responsibility and blamed Colombia's army.

She had been scheduled under a plea deal to serve 13 years in prison for the 2017 death of her husband. Her lawyer, Patrick Tomasiewicz, described her death as unexpected. Allan Kendrick, an Alabama pastor, recalled the moment he and his wife wrestled their grandson, Brandon Allan Kendrick II, who allegedly gunned down his wife and four children in his home. Despite concerns about his grandson's mental health, Kendrick continued chatting with him before the shooting, despite the stress. He said he led a prayer meeting an hour before the incident and had tried to help him for years. The pastor said he then wrestled his grandson to the ground and praised the prayers held an hour earlier. Kendrick's grandson was arrested and charged with capital murder with five counts of capital murder. His wife, Kelse Kendrick, their two children, Kaleb Kendrick, and Kynli Kendrick, 2, as well as their niece and nephew, Haley Daniels, 6, and Colton Daniels, 8, were all killed.

articles.summary: Eileen Teeton, wife of Army officer Lieutenant Colonel Mark Teeton who was stabbed outside an Army barracks in Kent, saved his life by pulling his attacker off of him and screaming for help. The incident occurred near Brompton Barracks, home of the 1 Royal School of Military Engineering Regiment, where Lt Col Teeton serves as a course manager. Anthony Esan, 24, has been charged with attempted murder and possession of an offensive weapon in a public place. He is yet to enter pleas. The attacker was reportedly partially covered in his face and had stabbed Lt Col. Teeton with a large knife or machete before fleeing on a moped. The attack was captured on a Ring doorbell camera belonging to a neighbour.

articles.summary: Republican presidential candidate Donald Trump narrowly escaped an assassination attempt on July 13, 2024, leaving his right ear bloodied by a bullet wound. The incident occurred at a campaign rally in Butler, Pennsylvania, where one attendee was killed and another two others critically wounded. Social media users shared photos of Trump playing golf with an intact ear with captions claiming it was taken after the shooting. However, these pictures pre-date the assassination attempt. The second photograph, taken in 2022, shows a visibly uninjured Trump wearing a red cap with "45" printed on the side.

articles.summary: Adrian Jerry Gonzalez, a 24-year-old California man who raped and murdered an 8-year old girl when he was 15, has been in court for a probable cause hearing to determine whether he is still a high threat to the community. The judge will decide if Gonzalez, who was convicted in juvenile court, could be eligible for release on parole when he turns 25 in October. He lured the girl, Madyson "Maddy" Middleton, into his parent's apartment and then murdered her before tossing her body into a trash container. Initially charged as an adult with murder, his case was halted in 2019 due to a law that bars 14 and 15 year-olds from being charged as adults.

articles.summary: Adrian Jerry Gonzalez, a 24-year-old California man who raped and murdered an 8-year old girl at the age of 15, has appeared before a Santa Cruz County judge to determine if he should be released from prison. Gonzalez was 15 when he lured the girl, Madyson "Maddy" Middleton, into his parent's apartment and then murdered her in 2015. He was convicted in juvenile court and could be eligible for parole when he turns 25 in October. Maddy's body was found in a trash container two days later. Initially charged as an adult with murder with the special circumstance that he kidnapped and sexually assaulted Maddy, and other related criminal offenses. However, his case was halted in 2019 due to a law barring 14 and 15-year olds from being charged as adults.

articles.title: Almost 20 years after California murder, suspect found in Mexico and returned to the U.S.

articles.summary: Luis Contreras, a suspected murderer of a 2005 murder in Riverside, California, has been found in Mexico and returned to the United States for prosecution. The case was reopened in June 2024 after the Riverside Police Department's Homicide Cold Case Unit reopened the case. The suspect, who was 32 at the time, allegedly fled to Mexico after being identified as a suspect in the murder. The fatal shooting occurred inside a residence in the 4700 block of Doane Avenue, where 38-year-old Alfonso Vera was found with multiple gunshot wounds. Of the three suspects involved in the shooting, two were arrested but no charges were filed due to a lack of evidence. Contreas was apprehended by civil police in Mexicali and transferred to the Riverside County Sheriff’s Cois M. Byrd Detention Center.

articles.summary: Penkridge Air Cadet group's minibus, paid for by teenagers, has been stolen by the thief, according to their leader, Denise Wilde. The vehicle, which was used for activities such as Duke of Edinburgh Award walks and activities, was intended to be used over the summer holidays for activities. The cadets, aged 13-19, had raised funds to buy the vehicle and cover its tax and insurance each year. The theft has been reported to police and Staffordshire Police has been contacted for comment. The bus was insured, but the loss of it is described as a significant loss as it provides a mobile base for the group and transport for their activities.

articles.summary: A Florida judge has ruled that controversial social media personality Andrew Tate's defamation lawsuit against a woman who accused him of imprisoning her in Romania can proceed. However, he dismissed Tate's allegations against her parents and some allegations against the woman. The judge stated that there is enough evidence that the woman defamed their clients and was attempting to defraud and extort them. The British-American brothers, who were indicted last year by Romanian officials, claim the woman falsely accused them of human trafficking and rape, costing them freedom and millions in income from their social media, podcasting and business ventures. No trial date has been set.
